intro: Arctotis massoniana, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, gray-green leaves. Its flowers bloom in shades of yellow, orange, and red, often with a white or pink center. It is commonly cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
